abstract: The $2.7 billion deal with Procter & Gamble will add a prominent brand to Kellogg’s existing snack offerings, helping the company increase its presence in snacks.
snippet: The $2.7 billion deal with Procter & Gamble will add a prominent brand to Kellogg’s existing snack offerings, helping the company increase its presence in snacks.
lead_paragraph: The Kellogg Company said on Wednesday that it would buy Pringles for about $2.7 billion in cash, swooping in on the snack company after an earlier agreement with Diamond Foods fell apart.

headline.main: Kellogg Wins Pringles After Diamond Deal Falls Apart

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
